newsitem.title: UK: Clarke may get away with UK rates on hold - CBI.
newsitem.headline: Clarke may get away with UK rates on hold - CBI.

text.p: Andrew Buxton, chairman of the Confederation of British Industry's Economic Affairs Committee said on Tuesday Chancellor of the Exchequer Kenneth Clarke may get away with leaving interest rates unchanged until the general election.

"There are signs of price pressures...but on the other hand there are price pressures on companies too and our survey shows that prices are not rising. The City is forecasting a rate rise before the election. But (Clarke) might get away with holding rates where they are if these price pressures keep up," he told RFTV in an interview.
Buxton was speaking as the CBI released its Quarterly Trends survey which showed manufacturing output and orders both up in the last four months.
Buxton said the CBI is sticking to its view that interest rates should be left on hold at 5.75 percent for the time being.
